title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 June 2008 - XWiki
content:
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 11:14): hi xipe   
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 11:15): i've added a little piece of text in the wiki describing my kerberos 'hack': http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 11:15): I need to upload the jar with source  somewhere, should i attach it to the topic ?  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 11:16): its really a simple hack of AppServerTrustedAuthServiceImpl , it just yanks off the @REALM after the principals name  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:21): hi KermitTheFragger   
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:21): is this code modification required to have http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication working?  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:22): (the kerberos SSO part)  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:22): then the question is: should this be part of xwiki code base or not?  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:22): hi vmassol !  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:23): if the answer is yes the best is for you to create a jira issue and add both your patch + the documentation in the jira issue  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:23): yes its required because mod\_auth\_kerb autheticates the user as [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:23): and we'll move it to xwiki.org when it's been released and working  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:23): and we need to chop off the @REALM.COM part  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:23): hmmm  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:23): but other then that its the same as AppServerTrustedAuthServiceImpl  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:24): this doesn't look generic so your patch should introduce a new AuthSerbiceImpl for Kerberos I think  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:24): since I don't think we can modify AppServerTrusted\* for this  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:24): as otherwise it won't work in other cases right?  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:24): true  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:25): i called it: AppServerTrustedKerberosAuthServiceImpl  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:25): in any case the best is to create a jira issue and put everything there  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:25): ok  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:25): could you also move the doc you've already put on xwiki.org there are rollback the version for the moment on xwiki.org?  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:25): or you could keep the Kerberos part  
vmassol - (23/06/2008 12:26): and point to the jira issue explaiing that it's pending being committed in the xwiki code base  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:27): ok, ill create the jira issue and ill put a warning thing on the wiki doc with a link to jira  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:28): nice job on xwiki btw, really great piece of work  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 12:29): vmassol: welcome back :)  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 12:30): thanks  
BC^bd - (23/06/2008 12:58): I have a problem with the finch skin:  
BC^bd - (23/06/2008 12:58): [ERROR] VM #breadcrumb: error : too few arguments to macro. Wanted 3 got 2  
BC^bd - (23/06/2008 12:58): [ERROR] VM error breadcrumb. Null AST  
BC^bd - (23/06/2008 12:58): [ERROR] Left side ($!hidecolumns) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible.  [line 6, column 21]  
KermitTheFragger - (23/06/2008 13:16): vmassol\_: i created an issue in Jira http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2496 and put a warning banner on top of the documentation segment  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 13:21): KermitTheFragger: thanks.  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:50): jvdrean: what's the status for the 1.5M2 release?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:50): or rather are you still ok for doing the release today (I hope so)  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:50): ?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:50): I'd really like to see the new admin committed asap  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 14:51): actually it is commited  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:51): so that all devs can test it and give you feedback on bugs/problems  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:51): really?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:51): I missed the commit then  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 14:51): I've commited it yesterday at 11:30pm  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:52): ok then maybe you could send an email on the devs list asking for quick feedback before such hour at which you'll start the 1.5M2 release  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:52): ?  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 14:52): I think I've encountered a blocker this morning  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:52): jvdrean: what rev was it?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:53): I don't see any email about it  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 14:53): vmassol\_: 10574  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:53): yes there was no email about it  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:54): maybe it was just too big?  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 14:54): I've received the email  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:55): has anyone else received it?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:55): jvelociter: have you?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:55): thomasmortagne: have you?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:55): in any case an email giving the release time for today would be great jvdrean and asking for testing before a given time would be great too  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 14:55): vmassol\_: I did  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:55): hmmm  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:55): weird  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 14:56): Thomas reviewed it this morning, he raised some issues I'm fixing right now  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:57): yes I can see it here: http://xwiki.markmail.org/search/?q=10574#query:10574+page:1+mid:4vf22xkjsur42jih+state:results  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:57): strange I didn't get it  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 14:58): I think Sergiu tried it last night but I haven't received comments from him  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:59): buildingnow  
thomasmortagne - (23/06/2008 14:59): vmassol\_: yes I received it  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 14:59): I'm the only one who haven't received it....  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 15:00): maybe it went to my spam folder on gmail and I deleted it by mistake, this is strange as I've reviewed my spam yesterday... anyway...  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:31): jvelociter: 1.5M2 should have alreayd been released last friday  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:32): vmassol\_: jvdrean thomasmortagne I was about to ask for your opinion  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:32): I've just finished my second round of tests on the new admin  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:33): (including ie6)  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:33): and ie7?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:33): rebuilding now to try the latest changes...  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:33): vmassol\_: I can have it commited tonight, not before  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:33): jvelociter: committed is not the issue  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:33): tested and working is the issue  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:33): :)  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:33): & tested :)  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:34): tonight is fine I think  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:34): as I said, Marius included unit tests  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:34): (that does not mean I won't test myself)  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:34): unit test are good but they don't prove that it works  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:34): (you need functional tests for that)  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:35): I still have one issue with ie7  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:35): jvelociter: is it used anywhere in XE?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:35): (I'm assessing the regression risks)  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:36): vmassol\_: not yet, the plan is to use it, but this can be done later  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:36): ok then risks are quite low  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:36): it's only introducing the API  
jvelociter - (23/06/2008 16:36): yes  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:37): jvdrean is the release manager so we need his go ahead for delaying by one more day  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:37): but I'd really like that we don't delay more  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:37): we haven't successfully delivered a release on time for a very long time now... :(  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:43): I'd like to test on last thing before sending the email about the 1.5M2 release  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:44): btw it's too late to release it today so Jerome go ahead with the RSS patch  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:48): jvdrean: the cancel button doesn't do anything but I'm sure you're aware of that... I think it should be removed altogether... wdyt?  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:48): yes it's a known issue (mentionned in my first commit IIRW)  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:48): yes I can remove the button  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:49): Save & Continue isn't correct either  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:49): should be just Save probably  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:50): btw I really have a hard time navigating back to the list of admin categories  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:55): jvdrean: I still have Links and blog categories inside  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 16:55): "Blog categories" is on purpose  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:57): I think it should be Blog but let's leave this one like this for now  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:57): I was talking about the one labelled "Links"  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:57): you said it's been reverted to Photo Album but it's not here  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:57): also it contains blog categories inside  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:58): by the way in English you put Capital letters everywhere in titles  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:58): so it's Space Preferences instead of Space preferences  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:58): and Blog Categories instead of Blog categories  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:58): but that's a detail...  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 16:58): an easy to fix detail though ;)  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:02): actually it's not fully clear in English if they should be capitalized or not. I think they are in most cases but I'm pretty sure you can examples where they're not. What's important is that we're consistent throughout our site  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 17:02): idea tells me that Photos/Links is not even in our repo :/  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 17:02): vmassol\_: I was searching for sources ;)  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:02): sources of?  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 17:02): capitalization in titles  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:03): http://www.google.fr/url?sa=t&ct=res&cd=1&url=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FCapitalization&ei=IbtfSPDRCo7y7AWusuDaCQ&usg=AFQjCNH0i6k1rRXjuJaWnWU0pcJKottShw&sig2=K740Z0PHWYW7Hj49dkbVnw  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:03): oops  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:03): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capitalization  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:03): but don't spend time on this  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:03): we can fix this later in RC I think  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:03): however I've rebuilt everything and I still have the Links icon  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:03): so you're saying it's supposed to be removed?  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 17:06): no it's not  
asyd - (23/06/2008 17:16): If I want to write a macro which interacts with external data (like http or webservices request), I guess I need to use java or groovy?  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 17:19): depends on the complexity of what you want to achieve  
jvdrean - (23/06/2008 17:20): you can do simple stuff with velocity and $xwiki.getURLContent("http://url")  
asyd - (23/06/2008 17:20): ah hmm interesting  
asyd - (23/06/2008 17:20): well I want to write some macro to interacts with a bugzilla  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:22): asyd: best is to write a java plugin for this  
asyd - (23/06/2008 17:22): ok  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 17:22): same as what we did for jira  
asyd - (23/06/2008 17:23): ok, I'll take a look. thanks  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:23): hi, vmassol.  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:24): daning: hi  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:24): vmassol\_: have have post a mail to maillist.   
daning - (23/06/2008 18:24): vmassol\_: s/have/I/  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:24): vmassol\_: Any suggestion?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:30): daning: just answered on the list  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:30): I haven't tried building and running your code yet. I'm putting that on my todo list.  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:32): vmassol\_: I have a question. Do we need to retain the <html> and <body> tags of the conversion html?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:33): daning: I don't understand  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:33): sorry  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:33): what we want to have is wiki syntax  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:33): I mean <html> and <head>  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:33): but <html> and <head> are not wiki syntax  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:33): which is why I don't understand the question  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:34): content of <head> contain some <style> and <metadata> tags.  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:35): should we just remove the whole <head> or handle the <style> and <metadata> of <head>?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:35): this need to be converetd  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:35): I think you should have a look at the Skin extension  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:35): and especially the CSS and JS extensions  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:35): OK. I'll.  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:35): let me get the url for you  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:36): daning: here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/SkinExtensions  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:36): these are implemented in xwiki as plugins so you can find them in the plugins area  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:37): I think we could maybe use this when converting an office doc  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:37): vmassol\_: another question. Can you give me the svn url of rendering module which contain the XHTML parser?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:37): it's in xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-rendering/  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:37): the class is WikiModelXHTMLParser  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:38): it's in the wikimodel submodule  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:38): vmassol\_: OK.  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:39): daning: read this: http://xwiki.markmail.org/search/?q=rendering+lookup&x=0&y=0#query:rendering%20lookup+page:1+mid:mkbijcginsssabfs+state:results  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:39): there's a code example  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:39): instead of "xwiki/2.0" it's "xhtml/1.0"  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:40): you don't need the transformations  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 18:40): and instead of the XHTML renderer you should use the XWikiSyntaxRenderer  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:43): My next job is read  Skin extension to clean html. and read xhtmlparser to convert xwiki syntax. WDYT?  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:43): What do you think about pictures in documents?  
daning - (23/06/2008 18:44): I want to upload pictures to the page as attachments. WDYT?  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 19:01): yes uploading the pictures sound good  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 19:01): (daning)  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:06): Hi David   
xwikibot - (23/06/2008 19:06): FAQ.SpaceAdmins was modified by XWiki.MikhaelSantos - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/SpaceAdmins  
daning - (23/06/2008 19:07): vmassol\_: I have to go sleep. It's late in my region. Bye.  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 19:07): daning: oj bye  
vmassol\_ - (23/06/2008 19:07): s/oj/ok  
xwikibot - (23/06/2008 19:07): FAQ.SpaceAdmins was modified by XWiki.MikhaelSantos - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/SpaceAdmins  
dward - (23/06/2008 19:13): SaiKrishna: Hello.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:14): Hi David   
dward - (23/06/2008 19:14): Hello.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:14): David : Just wanted to report my status  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:15): David : I am able to search multiple indexes on multiple machines, quite successfully :). I have also started integrating it into actuall XWiki Source code.  
dward - (23/06/2008 19:15): Great!  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:15): David : probably will come up with some version by the end of this week  
dward - (23/06/2008 19:15): I look forward to it.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:16): As informed earlier I am using RemoteSearchable class in lucene to acheive this.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:18): Each machine (slaves) makes its index available to the master machine on some port.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:19): And Master Node searches all those remote indexes parallelly   
dward - (23/06/2008 19:19): Sounds good.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:20): all configuration related should be set in xwiki.cfg -- right ?? like which port to run on, whether the particular machine is slave or master, such info..  
dward - (23/06/2008 19:21): Yes.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:21): ok  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:24): Right now I planning a design to intergate remote search to the existing xwiki lucene plugin. Once the desinging is done, it should be the matter of days to integrate in into XWiki, since most of the background has been done.  
dward - (23/06/2008 19:25): Okay.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:26): I will mail the design to you and dev list tomorrow, hope I will get some feedback :)  
dward - (23/06/2008 19:26): I'll watch for it.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:26): ok   
dward - (23/06/2008 19:28): You might want to update http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/DistributedXWikiSearchEngine as well.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:31): yeah I will  
dward - (23/06/2008 19:31): Thanks.  
SaiKrishna - (23/06/2008 19:31): :)  
sdumitriu - (23/06/2008 20:46): news
